lines: I'm sorry. This icon involves a steady relationship of some kind. These are the kind of experiences you miss out on when you are single. Please choose another episode. You may come back later.

You are about to spend the afternoon catching up on some work when your steady partner reminds you of a promise you made to fix the hem on his pants. You did promise, but right now, catching up on your work seems to be a higher priority.
Your partner doesn't seem to understand this. He keeps saying, "YOU PROMISED."

You don't want to do it, but you are afraid that if you don't go, your partner will nag you and make you miserable about it later. This way, you can make EACH OTHER miserable as soon as possible. Your anger prevents you from hemming
the pants well. One leg drags on the floor, and the other lets three inches of sock show. The two of you have a bad day together.
You can't figure out why your partner can't be a bit more understanding. Perhaps it really doesn't have much to do with the pants at all. Maybe your partner is feeling neglected lately.

Your guilt really masks anger at your partner for tearing you away from something important in order to do something that you think is not important. You will resent him for doing things like this, but it really isn't his fault. You
Your guilt about not keeping your promise preoccupies you. As a result, you can't concentrate on what you want to do and feel even worse.

He also admits that the real issue wasn't the pants at all. He has been feeling neglected lately and his insecurity was showing through. The two of you realize that it is probably better to discuss the feelings and issues behind things

You are probably the type who doesn't believe in making a big thing out of nothing. This is fine. However, sometimes things that appear to be unimportant on the surface mask other, more important issues.
Your partner gets very upset at your decision.
#TELL HIM HE IS NOT BEING VERY CONSIDERATE OF THE WORK YOU HAVE TO DO

You are telling him this because you believe your immediate need to complete your work is more important than his immediate need to have you hem his pants. The real issue, had you taken the time to discover it,is the fact that your
partner feels that you are not paying enough attention to him. He was feeling insecure, and this was his way of testing that you still care for him.
Your response to him sounds hostile and insensitive. Your relationship will never last if you keep this up.

You realize that it is likely that something more than meets the eye might be going on with your partner. As it turns out, he is feeling neglected by you lately, even though he knows you have work to do. He admits that he is feeling

After you finish your work, the two of you decide to go out to a cozy romantic place for lunch. Your compromise works out very well -- you get some of your work done, your partner is happy, and your relationship becomes a bit stronger.
